standard.name: ISO 22301
standard.description: This standard specifies requirements to implement, maintain and improve a management system to protect against, reduce the likelihood of, and ensure your business recovers from disruptive incidents.

controls.name: Business Impact Analysis (BIA)
controls.description: Conduct regular BIAs to identify critical business functions and the impact of disruption.

controls.name: Recovery Strategy
controls.description: Establish and maintain a strategy for recovery of critical business functions within an acceptable timeframe.

controls.name: Testing and Exercising
controls.description: Regularly test and exercise disaster recovery plans to ensure effectiveness and awareness.

risks.name: Inadequate Impact Analysis
risks.description: Failure to accurately identify critical functions, leading to inadequate recovery planning.

risks.name: Extended Downtime
risks.description: Prolonged recovery time due to insufficient recovery strategies.

risks.name: Ineffective DR Plans
risks.description: DR plans fail during a real incident due to lack of regular testing.

risks.name: Awareness Gaps
risks.description: Staff are unaware of DR procedures because of inadequate training and exercises.

standard.name: ITIL Change Management
standard.description: Framework for managing changes to IT services.

controls.name: Change Request Logging
controls.description: All changes must be logged with a detailed request.

controls.name: Change Impact Assessment
controls.description: Impact of changes must be assessed before approval.

controls.name: Change Approval Process
controls.description: All changes must be approved by authorized personnel.

risks.name: Unlogged Changes
risks.description: Changes made without logging could bypass controls.

risks.name: Improper Change Specification
risks.description: Insufficient details in change requests could lead to errors.

risks.name: Unassessed Changes
risks.description: Changes implemented without assessment could negatively impact services.

risks.name: Inadequate Risk Assessment
risks.description: Not identifying all risks during assessment could lead to service disruptions.

risks.name: Unauthorized Changes
risks.description: Changes made without proper approval could introduce vulnerabilities.

risks.name: Inefficiency in Change Process
risks.description: Delays in approval could slow down deployment of critical changes.

standard.name: ISO 20000
standard.description: ISO/IEC 20000 is the international standard for IT service management.

controls.name: Incident Logging
controls.description: Ensure all incidents are logged immediately in the incident management system.

controls.name: Root Cause Analysis
controls.description: Perform root cause analysis for all major incidents to prevent recurrence.

controls.name: Incident Resolution
controls.description: Resolve incidents within the defined SLA to ensure minimal business disruption.

risks.name: Unlogged Incidents
risks.description: Incidents may not be addressed in a timely manner if they are not logged.

risks.name: Incomplete Logging
risks.description: Incomplete incident logging may lead to inadequate resolution and future incidents.

risks.name: Unidentified Root Cause
risks.description: Failure to identify the root cause can lead to recurrent incidents.

risks.name: Delayed Resolution
risks.description: Failure to resolve incidents within SLA can result in extended business downtime.

standard.name: CAPM
standard.description: Capacity and Performance Management Standard

controls.name: Monitor System Performance
controls.description: Regularly monitor and measure system performance metrics to ensure optimal operation.

controls.name: Capacity Planning
controls.description: Develop and maintain a capacity plan to ensure that the computing resources are adequate for future business needs.

controls.name: Performance Testing
controls.description: Conduct performance testing to identify potential bottlenecks and ensure scalability of applications.

risks.name: System Overload
risks.description: Failure to monitor systems could result in unexpected system overloads and downtime.

risks.name: Insufficient Capacity
risks.description: Lack of proper capacity planning might lead to insufficient resources, impacting business operations.

risks.name: Undetected Performance Issues
risks.description: Performance issues may go undetected without regular performance testing, leading to poor user experience.

risks.name: Scalability Issues
risks.description: Inadequate scalability measures can hamper the system's ability to handle increased load.

standard.name: Network Security Standard
standard.description: Ensures the security and integrity of network infrastructure.

controls.name: Firewall Management
controls.description: Manage and monitor firewall configurations to prevent unauthorized access.

controls.name: Network Access Control
controls.description: Implement NAC to ensure only authorized devices can connect to the network.

controls.name: Intrusion Detection System
controls.description: Deploy and maintain IDS to detect and respond to network threats.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized individuals gaining access to the network.

risks.name: Firewall Misconfiguration
risks.description: Incorrect firewall settings can lead to vulnerabilities.

risks.name: Uncontrolled Device Access
risks.description: Devices without proper authorization can connect to the network, posing risks.

risks.name: Network Intrusion
risks.description: Potential for network breaches due to insufficient monitoring.

standard.name: Disaster Recovery Standard
standard.description: Guidelines for ensuring continuity and recovery of IT systems in the event of a disaster.

controls.name: Data Backup
controls.description: Regular backups of critical data to ensure it can be restored in case of data loss.

controls.name: Disaster Recovery Plan
controls.description: Comprehensive plan outlining procedures and responsibilities for disaster recovery.

controls.name: Recovery Testing
controls.description: Regular testing of disaster recovery procedures to ensure effectiveness.

risks.name: Data Loss
risks.description: Risk of losing critical data due to insufficient backup processes or failures.

risks.name: Slow Recovery
risks.description: Delayed recovery process due to an incomplete or poorly constructed disaster recovery plan.

risks.name: Unsuccessful Recovery
risks.description: Risk of recovery processes failing during an actual disaster due to inadequate testing.

risks.name: Resource Unavailability
risks.description: Critical resource shortages during disaster recovery due to incomplete planning.

risks.name: Backup Corruption
risks.description: Risk of backup data being corrupted or unusable when needed for recovery.

standard.name: Asset Management Standard
standard.description: Guidelines and practices for managing and controlling company assets.

controls.name: Asset Identification and Classification
controls.description: Ensure all company assets are identified, classified, and recorded accurately.

controls.name: Inventory Audit and Reconciliation
controls.description: Regular audits and reconciliations of physical inventory against records.

controls.name: Access Control for Asset Management Systems
controls.description: Restrict access to asset management systems to authorized personnel only.

risks.name: Inaccurate Asset Records
risks.description: Risk of having inaccurate or incomplete records of assets, leading to financial discrepancies.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access to Asset Information
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized individuals accessing sensitive asset information, leading to data breaches or asset misuse.

risks.name: Discrepancies in Physical Inventory
risks.description: Risk of discrepancies between physical inventory and recorded inventory, leading to potential loss or theft.

risks.name: Unauthorized System Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized access to asset management systems, leading to potential tampering or data corruption.

standard.name: Incident Response Standard
standard.description: This standard ensures effective incident management and response.

controls.name: Incident Identification and Reporting
controls.description: Identify and report incidents in a timely manner.

controls.name: Incident Classification and Prioritization
controls.description: Classify and prioritize incidents based on their impact and urgency.

controls.name: Incident Resolution and Recovery
controls.description: Manage the resolution and recovery of incidents to restore normal service.

risks.name: Delayed Incident Reporting
risks.description: Delayed reporting of incidents may result in prolonged impact and resolution time.

risks.name: Incorrect Classification
risks.description: Incorrect classification of incidents may lead to improper prioritization and handling.

risks.name: Incomplete Recovery
risks.description: Incomplete recovery actions may cause repeated incidents and affect service continuity.

standard.name: Vendor Management Standard
standard.description: Guidelines and requirements for managing third-party technology vendors.

controls.name: Vendor Risk Assessment
controls.description: Conduct regular risk assessments on third-party vendors to identify potential vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Contractual Obligations Review
controls.description: Ensure that contracts with third-party vendors include necessary security and compliance clauses.

controls.name: Ongoing Monitoring
controls.description: Implement ongoing monitoring procedures to track vendor compliance with contractual and security obligations.

risks.name: Security Breach Risk
risks.description: Risk of a security breach due to inadequate vendor risk assessment.

risks.name: Compliance Risk
risks.description: Risk of non-compliance with regulatory requirements due to insufficient review of contractual obligations.

risks.name: Vendor Non-compliance Risk
risks.description: Risk of vendors failing to meet agreed-upon security and compliance standards.

risks.name: Operational Disruption Risk
risks.description: Risk of operational disruptions due to vendor performance issues.

standard.name: ISO 22301
standard.description: International standard for Business Continuity Management Systems (BCMS)

controls.name: Business Impact Analysis
controls.description: Identify and evaluate the impact of disruptions to business operations.

controls.name: Recovery Strategy
controls.description: Develop recovery strategies to restore business operations.

controls.name: BCM Plan Development
controls.description: Create and maintain Business Continuity Management plans.

risks.name: Inaccurate Impact Assessment
risks.description: Failing to accurately determine the impact of disruptions can lead to inadequate recovery plans.

risks.name: Resource Shortage
risks.description: Lack of resources can hinder the execution of recovery strategies.

risks.name: BCM Plan Incompleteness
risks.description: Missing critical components in the BCM plan can lead to ineffective response during disruptions.

risks.name: Outdated BCM Plan
risks.description: An outdated BCM plan can be ineffective in addressing current risks and disruptions.

standard.name: Cybersecurity Standard
standard.description: Standard for managing and mitigating cybersecurity risks.

controls.name: Access Control
controls.description: Implementing measures to ensure that only authorized individuals have access to critical systems and data.

controls.name: Incident Response
controls.description: Establishing an incident response plan to address and manage the aftermath of a security breach or cyberattack.

controls.name: Regular Audits
controls.description: Conducting regular security audits and assessments to identify vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with security policies.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized individuals gaining access to sensitive information, potentially leading to data breaches or other malicious activities.

risks.name: Access Control Failure
risks.description: Risk that access control measures are bypassed or fail, resulting in unauthorized access.

risks.name: Delayed Incident Response
risks.description: Risk of delays in identifying and responding to security incidents, increasing the potential impact of cyber threats.

risks.name: Ineffective Incident Management
risks.description: Risk that incident response efforts are insufficient or improperly executed, leading to prolonged recovery times and increased damage.

risks.name: Audit Inconsistencies
risks.description: Risk that audits fail to uncover existing vulnerabilities or are not conducted according to set standards.

standard.name: SDLC Standard
standard.description: Standard guidelines for the Software Development Life Cycle.

controls.name: Code Review
controls.description: All code changes must be reviewed by at least one independent reviewer.

controls.name: Automated Testing
controls.description: Automated tests must be run for all code changes before they are merged.

controls.name: Version Control
controls.description: All source code must be stored in a version control system.

risks.name: Unreviewed Code
risks.description: Code changes are not reviewed and contain bugs or security vulnerabilities.

risks.name: Test Failures
risks.description: Automated tests fail and code with bugs is merged, causing system issues.

risks.name: Lack of Version Control
risks.description: Changes to the codebase are not tracked, leading to potential loss of data and accountability.

risks.name: Unverified Code Changes
risks.description: Code changes that bypass automated testing may lead to stability issues.

standard.name: Job Scheduling Standard
standard.description: Standard for ensuring efficient and reliable job scheduling.

controls.name: Job Queue Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor the job queue to ensure jobs are processed in a timely manner.

controls.name: Job Conflict Resolution
controls.description: Identify and resolve conflicts between scheduled jobs to prevent overlaps and resource contention.

controls.name: Job Execution Verification
controls.description: Verify the successful execution of jobs and handle any failures or errors promptly.

risks.name: Job Queue Overflow
risks.description: A large number of jobs in the queue may delay job processing.

risks.name: Job Mismanagement
risks.description: Conflicts between jobs may lead to resource contention and job failures.

risks.name: Job Execution Failure
risks.description: Failure to execute jobs correctly can lead to data loss or system downtime.

risks.name: Error Handling Delay
risks.description: Delays in handling job execution errors may impact system reliability.

standard.name: ISO 27001
standard.description: Standard for managing information security.

controls.name: Access Control Management
controls.description: Ensure that access to data is restricted to authorized personnel only.

controls.name: Data Encryption
controls.description: Encrypt sensitive data both at rest and in transit to protect against unauthorized access.

controls.name: Data Backup and Recovery
controls.description: Regularly back up data and have a recovery plan in place to ensure data integrity.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Unauthorized personnel may access and manipulate sensitive data.

risks.name: Data Breach
risks.description: Sensitive data may be exposed due to weak encryption practices.

risks.name: Data Loss
risks.description: Critical data may be lost due to inadequate backup and recovery procedures.

risks.name: Data Corruption
risks.description: Backup data may be corrupted, affecting the integrity of recovery.

standard.name: COBIT 2019
standard.description: A framework for developing, implementing, monitoring, and improving IT governance and management practices.

controls.name: Budget Planning and Management
controls.description: Ensure that IT budgets are planned and managed effectively to support business objectives.

controls.name: Cost Management
controls.description: Establish a cost management framework to track and control IT expenses.

controls.name: Financial Performance Measurement
controls.description: Measure and monitor financial performance to ensure that IT investments deliver expected business value.

risks.name: Budget Overruns
risks.description: Risk of exceeding the planned IT budget due to unforeseen expenses or poor budget management.

risks.name: Inadequate Cost Tracking
risks.description: Risk of failing to accurately track and manage IT costs, leading to financial inefficiencies.

risks.name: Poor ROI
risks.description: Risk of IT investments not delivering the expected return on investment, leading to financial losses.

standard.name: Encryption Standard
standard.description: Standard guidelines for encryption management.

controls.name: Data Encryption at Rest
controls.description: Ensures that all sensitive data is encrypted when stored.

controls.name: Data Encryption in Transit
controls.description: Secures sensitive data by encrypting it during transmission.

controls.name: Encryption Key Management
controls.description: Manages encryption keys securely and ensures regular key rotation.

risks.name: Unauthorized Data Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive data if encryption is not properly implemented.

risks.name: Data Breach During Transmission
risks.description: Risk of data being intercepted during transmission without proper encryption.

risks.name: Key Compromise
risks.description: Risk of encryption keys being stolen or compromised, leading to potential data breaches.

risks.name: Key Mismanagement
risks.description: Risk of improper key management practices leading to loss of sensitive data.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27002
standard.description: Standards for information security controls.

controls.name: Patch Deployment Schedule
controls.description: Establish a regular patch deployment schedule to ensure all systems are up to date with the latest patches.

controls.name: Patch Testing
controls.description: Test patches in a controlled environment before deployment to minimize disruptions and verify compatibility.

controls.name: Patch Documentation
controls.description: Maintain detailed documentation of all patches, including date of deployment, systems affected, and any issues encountered.

risks.name: Unpatched Vulnerabilities
risks.description: If patches are not deployed regularly, systems may be vulnerable to known security threats.

risks.name: Patch Failure
risks.description: The failure to deploy a patch successfully can leave systems unprotected.

risks.name: Compatibility Issues
risks.description: Patches may cause compatibility issues with existing applications, leading to potential downtime.

risks.name: Testing Inefficiencies
risks.description: Inadequate testing may result in overlooked issues, causing larger problems upon deployment.

risks.name: Incomplete Documentation
risks.description: Failure to maintain proper documentation can lead to gaps in patch management records and troubleshooting difficulties.

standard.name: Vulnerability Management Standard
standard.description: Guidelines for managing vulnerabilities in systems and applications.

controls.name: Regular Vulnerability Scanning
controls.description: Conduct regular scans to identify vulnerabilities in the system.

controls.name: Patch Management
controls.description: Ensure timely application of patches to mitigate identified vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Vulnerability Assessment
controls.description: Perform comprehensive assessments to evaluate and prioritize vulnerabilities.

risks.name: Unidentified Vulnerabilities
risks.description: Risk of vulnerabilities not being identified due to infrequent scans.

risks.name: Delayed Patching
risks.description: Risk of vulnerabilities being exploited due to delayed patching.

risks.name: Incomplete Assessment
risks.description: Risk of not fully assessing vulnerabilities, leading to oversight.

risks.name: Incorrect Prioritization
risks.description: Risk of incorrectly prioritizing vulnerabilities, leading to resource misallocation.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: International standard for information security management systems (ISMS).

controls.name: Access Control Policy
controls.description: Establishing and managing an access control policy.

controls.name: Incident Management Policy
controls.description: Properly managing and responding to IT and security incidents.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access Risk
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive information due to inadequate access controls.

risks.name: Data Breach Risk
risks.description: Risk of data breaches resulting from improper handling of security incidents.

risks.name: Delayed Incident Response Risk
risks.description: Risk of delayed response to security incidents leading to increased damage.

standard.name: Metrics Reporting Standard
standard.description: Standard for reporting technology metrics to ensure accuracy and consistency.

controls.name: Data Validation Control
controls.description: Ensures all reported data is validated for accuracy.

controls.name: Access Control
controls.description: Restricts access to metric reporting tools to authorized personnel only.

controls.name: Reporting Frequency
controls.description: Mandates regular reporting intervals to maintain up-to-date metrics.

risks.name: Data Inaccuracy
risks.description: Risk of reporting inaccurate metrics due to lack of validation.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized personnel accessing and manipulating metrics.

risks.name: Outdated Metrics
risks.description: Risk of using outdated information due to irregular reporting intervals.

standard.name: APM Standard
standard.description: Standard for managing the application portfolio efficiently

controls.name: Application Inventory Management
controls.description: Ensure all applications are catalogued and regularly updated

controls.name: Application Lifecycle Management
controls.description: Manage the lifecycle of applications from onboarding to retirement

controls.name: Application Performance Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor and report application performance metrics

risks.name: Incomplete Application Inventory
risks.description: Risk of having an incomplete record of applications, leading to unmanaged or redundant applications

risks.name: Outdated Application Information
risks.description: Risk of having outdated information on applications, affecting decision-making

risks.name: Lifecycle Management Failures
risks.description: Risk of failing to manage the full lifecycle of applications, leading to security vulnerabilities or obsolete applications

risks.name: Performance Degradation
risks.description: Risk of applications experiencing performance issues due to lack of monitoring

risks.name: Unreported Incidents
risks.description: Risk of incidents not being reported due to lack of performance monitoring

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: International standard for information security management.

controls.name: User Access Review
controls.description: Regular reviews of user access rights to ensure they are appropriate for their role.

controls.name: Multi-factor Authentication
controls.description: Implementation of multi-factor authentication for all privileged accounts.

controls.name: Least Privilege Principle
controls.description: Enforcement of least privilege principle, ensuring users have the minimum level of access needed for their role.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of users gaining access to systems or data they are not authorized to view or modify.

risks.name: Access Rights Mismanagement
risks.description: Risk of incorrectly assigned or forgotten access rights leading to potential security breaches.

risks.name: Credential Theft
risks.description: Risk of credentials being stolen and used to gain unauthorized access.

risks.name: Inadequate Access Control
risks.description: Risk of insufficient access controls allowing unauthorized access.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: International standard for information security management systems (ISMS).

controls.name: Secure Area Perimeters
controls.description: Physical security perimeters (barriers such as walls or card-controlled entry gates) should be used to protect areas that contain either sensitive or critical information and information processing facilities.

controls.name: Physical Entry Controls
controls.description: Secure areas should be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

controls.name: Equipment Security
controls.description: Equipment should be located and protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and opportunities for unauthorized access.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized personnel gaining access to secure areas, leading to potential data breaches or theft.

risks.name: Physical Intrusion
risks.description: Risk of physical intrusion into restricted areas, compromising the integrity and confidentiality of information.

risks.name: Tailgating
risks.description: Unauthorized individuals following authorized personnel into secure areas without appropriate credentials.

risks.name: Theft of Equipment
risks.description: Risk of equipment theft leading to potential data loss or unauthorized access to sensitive information.

risks.name: Environmental Damage
risks.description: Risks such as fire, flooding, or extreme temperatures causing damage to equipment and data.

standard.name: SDLC Best Practices
standard.description: Standard to ensure adherence to SDLC best practices.

controls.name: Requirements Analysis
controls.description: Ensure thorough requirements analysis is conducted before development begins.

controls.name: Code Review
controls.description: Conduct regular code reviews to maintain code quality and security.

controls.name: Testing and Validation
controls.description: Perform comprehensive testing and validation of software components before deployment.

risks.name: Incorrect Requirements
risks.description: Incorrect or incomplete requirements may lead to project failure.

risks.name: Security Vulnerabilities
risks.description: Lack of code reviews may introduce security vulnerabilities.

risks.name: Operational Failures
risks.description: Inadequate testing may result in software operational failures.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: International standard for information security management systems.

controls.name: Secure Code Review
controls.description: Regular code reviews should be conducted to identify security vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with secure coding standards.

controls.name: Application Penetration Testing
controls.description: Conducting penetration tests on applications to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Input Validation
controls.description: All input data should be validated to prevent security vulnerabilities such as SQL injection and XSS.

risks.name: Vulnerabilities in Code
risks.description: Security vulnerabilities in the application code could lead to unauthorized access and data breaches.

risks.name: Compliance Violations
risks.description: Failure to comply with secure coding standards could result in legal and regulatory penalties.

risks.name: Unidentified Security Flaws
risks.description: Undiscovered security flaws could be exploited by malicious actors to compromise the application.

risks.name: Mitigation Failure
risks.description: Inadequate mitigation of identified vulnerabilities during penetration testing could lead to exploitation.

risks.name: Injection Attacks
risks.description: Improper input validation could expose the application to injection attacks such as SQL injection.

risks.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
risks.description: Lack of proper input validation could result in cross-site scripting attacks.

standard.name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
standard.description: A comprehensive framework to improve the cybersecurity posture of organizations.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Gathering
controls.description: Regularly obtain and analyze threat intelligence from multiple sources.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Sharing
controls.description: Share relevant threat intelligence with internal stakeholders and external partners.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Analysis
controls.description: Perform in-depth analysis on gathered threat intelligence to identify potential threats and attack vectors.

risks.name: Incomplete Threat Intelligence
risks.description: Failure to gather comprehensive threat intelligence may lead to undetected threats.

risks.name: Delayed Threat Intelligence
risks.description: Delays in obtaining threat intelligence can result in late mitigation actions.

risks.name: Misinformation Sharing
risks.description: Sharing inaccurate threat intelligence can mislead stakeholders and partners.

risks.name: Overlooked Threats
risks.description: Inadequate analysis may lead to overlooking potential threats.

risks.name: False Positives
risks.description: Incorrect analysis may result in false positive alerts, leading to unnecessary actions.

standard.name: NIST SP 800-137
standard.description: National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-137 provides Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM) for Federal Information Systems and Organizations guidelines.

controls.name: Log Management
controls.description: Ensure that all network activities are logged and monitored.

controls.name: Alerting Mechanisms
controls.description: Implement alerting mechanisms for suspicious activities detected in logs.

controls.name: Regular Audit Logs
controls.description: Conduct regular audits of logs to ensure compliance and detect anomalies.

risks.name: Undetected Security Breaches
risks.description: If network activities are not properly logged, security breaches may go undetected.

risks.name: Alert Fatigue
risks.description: Excessive alerts can lead to alert fatigue, causing personnel to miss critical security events.

risks.name: Non-Compliance
risks.description: Failure to conduct regular audits may result in non-compliance with regulatory requirements.

risks.name: Missed Anomalies
risks.description: Inadequate audit practices can lead to missed detection of anomalies in logs.

process_name: Tech Risk Assessment and Control Testing

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: Information Security Management System standard.

controls.name: Access Control Policy
controls.description: Ensure that access to information is restricted to authorized users.

controls.name: Incident Management
controls.description: Establish and maintain procedures for managing incidents.

controls.name: Cryptographic Controls
controls.description: Establish and use cryptographic controls where appropriate.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized users gaining access to sensitive information.

risks.name: Data Breach
risks.description: Risk of sensitive data being breached due to lack of access controls.

risks.name: Prolonged Downtime
risks.description: Risk of prolonged downtime due to improperly managed incidents.

risks.name: Data Integrity
risks.description: Risk of data corruption or loss due to inadequate cryptographic controls.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: Information Security Management System standard.

controls.name: Access Control Policy
controls.description: Ensure that access control policies are established and maintained based on business needs and security requirements.

controls.name: Network Security Management
controls.description: Ensure the protection of information in networks and the protection of the supporting infrastructure.

controls.name: Cryptographic Controls
controls.description: Ensure the proper and effective use of cryptography to protect the confidentiality, authenticity, and/or integrity of information.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Unauthorized entities gaining access to sensitive information through insufficient access control mechanisms.

risks.name: Insider Threat
risks.description: Internal personnel abusing access privileges leading to data breaches or malicious activities.

risks.name: Network Intrusion
risks.description: Unauthorized access to the network leading to compromised systems and data breaches.

risks.name: Denial of Service Attack
risks.description: Disruption of services due to an attack overwhelming the network's resources.

risks.name: Weak Encryption
risks.description: Usage of obsolete or weak encryption methods leading to exposure of sensitive data.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: Information Security Management Standard

controls.name: User Access Review
controls.description: Periodic review of user access rights to ensure that only authorized individuals have access to systems and data.

controls.name: Multi-factor Authentication
controls.description: Implementation of multi-factor authentication (MFA) to enhance security for system access.

controls.name: Access Termination
controls.description: Timely termination of access rights for individuals who are no longer authorized to use the systems.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized individuals gaining access to sensitive data and systems.

risks.name: Account Compromise
risks.description: Risk of user accounts being compromised, leading to potential data breaches.

risks.name: Orphaned Accounts
risks.description: Risk of accounts not being properly terminated, potentially being exploited by unauthorized individuals.

risks.name: Insider Threat
risks.description: Risk of current or former employees abusing their access rights.

standard.name: ISO 27001
standard.description: International standard for information security management

controls.name: Conduct Regular Training
controls.description: Provide regular information security training sessions for all employees.

controls.name: Phishing Awareness
controls.description: Conduct phishing awareness campaigns and training.

controls.name: Policy Acknowledgement
controls.description: Ensure all employees acknowledge the security policies.

risks.name: Lack of Knowledge
risks.description: Employees may lack the necessary knowledge to comply with security protocols, leading to potential security breaches.

risks.name: Social Engineering Attacks
risks.description: Employees may fall victim to social engineering attacks due to lack of awareness.

risks.name: Phishing Emails
risks.description: Employees may not recognize phishing emails, leading to credential theft.

risks.name: Policy Non-Compliance
risks.description: Employees may not comply with security policies if they do not acknowledge them.

standard.name: ISO 21500
standard.description: Guidelines on project management.

controls.name: Project Charter Approval
controls.description: Ensure the project charter is reviewed and approved by the project sponsor.

controls.name: Stakeholder Engagement Plan
controls.description: Develop and maintain a stakeholder engagement plan to ensure effective communication and stakeholder involvement.

controls.name: Risk Management Plan
controls.description: Create and implement a risk management plan that identifies, assesses, and mitigates project risks.

risks.name: Unapproved Project Charter
risks.description: Proceeding with the project without an approved charter may lead to misalignment of project objectives.

risks.name: Stakeholder Miscommunication
risks.description: Inadequate stakeholder communication may result in misunderstandings and project delays.

risks.name: Unidentified Project Risks
risks.description: Failure to identify and manage project risks can lead to project failure or significant issues.

risks.name: Inadequate Risk Mitigation
risks.description: Poorly developed risk mitigation strategies can fail to prevent issues, causing project disruptions.

standard.name: Technology Governance Standard
standard.description: Guidelines and procedures for effective technology strategy management.

controls.name: Technology Roadmap Development
controls.description: Develop and maintain a technology roadmap aligned with business goals.

controls.name: Innovation Pipeline Management
controls.description: Manage the pipeline of technological innovations to ensure alignment with strategy.

controls.name: Strategic Partnership Management
controls.description: Foster and manage strategic partnerships to leverage technological advancements.

risks.name: Misalignment with Business Goals
risks.description: The technology roadmap may not align with business objectives.

risks.name: Innovation Overload
risks.description: Too many innovations in the pipeline may overwhelm resources.

risks.name: Dependence on Partners
risks.description: Over-reliance on strategic partners poses a risk if partners fail to deliver.

risks.name: Technological Obsolescence
risks.description: Existing technologies may become obsolete due to rapid advancements.

standard.name: Data Management Standard
standard.description: Guidelines and requirements for effective management of enterprise data.

controls.name: Data Quality Monitoring
controls.description: Regularly monitor the quality of data to ensure accuracy and consistency.

controls.name: Access Control Management
controls.description: Establish and manage access controls to safeguard enterprise data.

controls.name: Data Backup and Recovery
controls.description: Implement regular data backup and recovery processes to prevent data loss.

risks.name: Data Inaccuracy
risks.description: Inaccurate data can lead to faulty decision-making and operational inefficiencies.

risks.name: Data Consistency Issues
risks.description: Inconsistent data can result in conflicting information and unreliable reporting.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Unauthorized access to data can lead to data breaches and loss of sensitive information.

risks.name: Access Mismanagement
risks.description: Poorly managed access controls can result in excessive or insufficient permissions.

risks.name: Data Loss
risks.description: Loss of data due to inadequate backup and recovery processes can cause significant operational disruptions.

standard.name: Cyber Security Incident Management Standard
standard.description: Standard for managing cyber security incidents, including preparation, detection, and response.

controls.name: Incident Detection and Reporting
controls.description: Implement and maintain processes to detect and report security incidents in a timely manner.

controls.name: Incident Response Plan
controls.description: Develop and maintain an incident response plan that outlines procedures for responding to security incidents.

controls.name: Post-Incident Review
controls.description: Conduct post-incident reviews to analyze and improve incident response processes.

risks.name: Undetected Security Incident
risks.description: Risk of security incidents remaining undetected due to inadequate detection mechanisms.

risks.name: Delayed Incident Reporting
risks.description: Risk of delays in reporting security incidents, leading to increased damage.

risks.name: Ineffective Incident Response
risks.description: Risk of ineffective response to security incidents due to lack of an established plan.

risks.name: Insufficient Incident Documentation
risks.description: Risk of insufficient documentation and lessons learned from past incidents, which can impair future response efforts.

standard.name: Data Protection Standard
standard.description: Ensures proper backup and replication procedures are in place to protect data.

controls.name: Regular Backup Schedule
controls.description: Maintain a regular backup schedule to ensure data is consistently backed up.

controls.name: Replication Integrity Verification
controls.description: Regularly verify the integrity of replicated data to avoid corruption or loss.

controls.name: Access Control for Backup Data
controls.description: Implement strict access control measures for backup data to prevent unauthorized access.

risks.name: Backup Failure
risks.description: Risk of backup processes failing, leading to loss of data.

risks.name: Data Corruption in Replication
risks.description: Risk of data being corrupted during the replication process.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access to Backup Data
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized access to sensitive backup data.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 20000
standard.description: Information technology — Service management

controls.name: Configuration Identification
controls.description: Ensure all components of the IT system are identified and tracked.

controls.name: Configuration Control
controls.description: Establish and maintain consistency of a product's performance and functional attributes with its requirements.

controls.name: Configuration Status Accounting
controls.description: Record and report information needed to manage a configuration effectively, including the status of proposed changes and the implementation status of approved changes.

risks.name: Misidentified Components
risks.description: Risk of IT components being wrongly identified, leading to potential system errors.

risks.name: Unauthorized Changes
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized changes being made to the configuration.

risks.name: Inaccurate Reporting
risks.description: Risk of inaccuracies in the status reports affecting decision-making.

risks.name: Change Implementation Delays
risks.description: Risk of delays in implementing approved changes due to status miscommunication.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: Information Security Management

controls.name: Access Control
controls.description: Ensure that access to information and information processing facilities is limited to authorized users.

controls.name: Change Management
controls.description: Manage changes to organization, business processes, information processing facilities, and systems that affect information security.

controls.name: Incident Management
controls.description: Ensure a consistent and effective approach to the management of information security incidents.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Risk of unauthorized access to information systems.

risks.name: Data Breach
risks.description: Risk of data breaches due to insufficient access controls.

risks.name: Uncontrolled Changes
risks.description: Risk of changes being made without proper review and approval.

risks.name: System Downtime
risks.description: Risk of system downtime due to poorly managed changes.

risks.name: Incident Mismanagement
risks.description: Risk of incidents not being managed effectively and timely.
